N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 ยง 830.4 - Period for which penalties are assessed

State Regulations

Penalties are calculated by calendar day. If an employer
has not corrected a violation by the abatement date, the first day for which a
penalty will be assessed is the day following the abatement date. Penalties
will continue to run until such time as the department has confirmed that the
employer has corrected the violation. The last day for which a penalty will be
assessed is the compliance date. An order to comply with section
27-a
of the Labor

Law shall be issued to the employer following the compliance date, notifying
the employer of the final amount of penalties due; however, nothing in this
section shall limit the right of the commissioner to enforce the payment of
penalties due in connection with any violation prior to the date on which such
violation is complied. Notes
